description: The value of this object is a bitmap that qualifies the
value of the operational and administrative states.
When the value of this object is 0, none of the
status conditions are present.
bit
value resource condition
1 inTest - undergoing a test procedure
2 failed - has an internal fault preventing its
operation
4 powerOff - requires power, but is not powered on
8 offLine - requires a routine operation to put it
online
16 offDuty - is inactive by an internal control process
32 dependency - cannot operate because it depends on an
unavailable resource
64 degraded - service provided is degraded (speed
capacity, or etc.)
128 notInstalled - not present or incomplete
256 logFull - for a log only, indicates that it is full

variables.name: ADN-MIB::adnEquipX731Avail

description: The value of this object provides additional information
concerning the availability status (adnEquipX731Avail) of
the equipment. It is a bitmap of installation status
conditions. When the value of this object is 0, none of
the status conditions are present.
bit value meaning qualifies
1 absent 'notInstalled'
2 notConfigured 'notInstalled'
4 initializationIncomplete 'offLine'
128 incorrectConfiguration 'failed'
The following bit positions are deprecated:
bit value meaning qualifies
8 operatorInitiatedLastRestart any setting
16 initializationRequired 'offLine'
32 reservedForTest 'inTest'
64 testInitiated 'inTest'
variables.name: ADN-MIB::adnEquipInstallStatus

description: This object provides a mechanism for controlling the status
of the equipment. Its value is a bitmap of controls that
determine the value of adnEquipX731Admin. A value of
0 indicates that none of the status controls are in effect.
bit
value meaning
1 suspend - put card (except control unit (CU)) in
permanent reset
2 coldRestart - restart equipment, interrupting service
- node and card (except CU) on HSS; node, card
and interface on TPX
4 mildRestart - restart equipment, and do not interrupt
service - only for active or standby CU card
32 initiateTest - begin test - standby CU card only
64 manualSwitchover - switch to backup - primary MSC,
CIG, and BBASE cards and active CU cards only
128 manualSwitchback - switch to primary - primary MSC,
CIG, and BBASE cards only
256 osRebuild - all firmware and disk contents are copied
fromthe active CU card - standby CU card only
The following bit values are deprecated:
value meaning
8 debugModeAfterCrash (do not reload operational
code after crash and allow viewing of
card's data structures)
16 reserveForTest

description: This object notifies the NMS of the `state' of code/
configuration update processing. The values are:
committed -- The node is running the committed
software version.
activateInProgress -- An Activate command is in
progress.
uncommitted -- The node is running the uncommitted
software version.
activateInProgressSuspended -- An Activate command
is in progress. The processing of
the Activate is suspended while the
Control Unit board waits for a
confirmation that any coupler boards
that have been reset have gone down
before Activate processing continues.
loadingCommittedSuspended -- The node is in the
process of loading the committed
software version, due to a Deactivate
command or an automatic rollback.
The processing of the deactivation is
suspended while the Control Unit board
waits for a confirmation that any
coupler boards that have been reset
have gone down, before deactivation
processing continues.
loadingCommitted -- The node is in the process of
loading the committed software version
due to a Deactivate command or an
automatic rollback.
qConfirmed -- The node is running a confirmed Quick
configuration change on top of the
committed version.
qActivateInProgress -- A Quick Install&Activate
command is in progress.
qUnconfirmed -- The node is running the unconfirmed
Quick configuration.
qLoadingConfirmed -- The node is in the process of
loading the confirmed Quick configuration
due to a Quick Deactivate&Withdraw command
or an automatic rollback.
qRebaselineInProgress -- A Quick Rebaseline command is
in progress.

description: This object identifies the pathname of the node-level
version descriptor file for the HSS software version that
is currently running. The format of the filename is
vd.<w><x><yy><zz>.<aa>, where
<w><x><yy><zz> is the HSS software version number and
<aa> is the value modulo 100 of the NMS configuration
number, which is incremented at the NMS whenever a new
HSS software and/or configuration package is built.
<w> is the product release number (1 digit, 0-9)
<x> is the functional version (1 digit, 0-9)
<yy> is the sub-function version within the <wx>
release (2 digits, 00-99),
<zz> is the fix version number, (2 digits, 01-99), and
<aa> is a number that the Network Management System
assigns to insure uniqueness of the version number,
variables.name: ADN-MIB::adnNodeRunningVersion

description: This object identifies the pathname of the node-level
version descriptor file for the committed (validated)
HSS software version. The format of the filename is
vd.<w><x><yy><zz>.<aa>, where
<w><x><yy><zz> is the HSS software version number and
<aa> is the value modulo 100 of the NMS configuration
number, which is incremented at the NMS whenever a new
HSS software and/or configuration package is built.
<w> is the product release number (1 digit, 0-9)
<x> is the functional version (1 digit, 0-9)
<yy> is the sub-function version within the <wx>
release (2 digits, 00-99),
<zz> is the fix version number, (2 digits, 01-99), and
<aa> is a number that the Network Management System
assigns to insure uniqueness of the version number,
variables.name: ADN-MIB::adnNodeCommittedVersion

description: This object identifies the pathname of the node-level
version descriptor file for the uncommitted (non-validated)
HSS software version. The format of the filename is
vd.<w><x><yy><zz>.<aa>, where
<w><x><yy><zz> is the HSS software version number and
<aa> is the value modulo 100 of the NMS configuration
number, which is incremented at the NMS whenever a new
HSS software and/or configuration package is built.
<w> is the product release number (1 digit, 0-9)
<x> is the functional version (1 digit, 0-9)
<yy> is the sub-function version within the <wx>
release (2 digits, 00-99),
<zz> is the fix version number, (2 digits, 01-99), and
<aa> is a number that the Network Management System
assigns to insure uniqueness of the version number,
If there is no uncommitted software version, then a null
string is returned.

yet been downloaded to the node from the
Network Management System.

description: The main PMD application sends this trap to the
NMS to indicate that a PMD file is ready for collection.
The full name of the PMD file is given. If
adnPmdDumpExecutionReport has the value `alreadyBuilt'
a PMD file already exists for the same fault, and the
requested PMD has not been built. This fault has occurred
for the adnPmdFrequencyCount time(s).
adnPmdNodeSurveillance is set if the file has to be
picked up by the NMS. This variable can be modified only
by the NMS.
adnPmdTargetIdentification indicates the chassis, slot
and processor where the PMD has been built.

event.Summary: PMD dump file ready for collection

variables.name: ADN-MIB::adnPmdDumpFilePathName

description: This defines whether or not the NMS will get the post
mortem dump (PMD) files from the node's to_nms transfer
directory.
If the node is under surveillance (enable) the NMS won't
get the PMD files from the to_nms transfer directory
but the PMD files continues to be created in this
directory.
This causes no modification of the PMD mechanism behavior.
variables.name: ADN-MIB::adnPmdNodeSurveillance

description: If the PMD has actually been built, it is ok(1). If it
has not been built because the filter mechanism knows that
a PMD was previously built for the same fault, it is
alreadyBuilt(3), and the file name is filled with the
known value.
variables.name: ADN-MIB::adnPmdDumpExecutionReport

description: This variable indicates how often a particular
fault is occurring.
variables.name: ADN-MIB::adnPmdFrequencyCount

description: This variable indicates the processor experiencing
the fault.
The variable is expressed with 5 digits.
The first one gives the chassis number
the next two digits give the slot number and
the two last digits give the processor number.
So, the value CSSPP means that the PMD has been
generated by the processor PP of the slot SS of
the chassis C.
variables.name: ADN-MIB::adnPmdTargetIdentification

description: The main PMD application sends this trap to the NMS to
indicate that a PMD has failed. If the PMD started and
failed during execution, adnPmdDumpExecutionReport
returns an error code of 'aborted'. If the PMD never
started, then adnPmdDumpExecutionReport returns error
code 'nok' (not okay).
adnPmdNodeSurveillance is set if the file has to be
picked up by the NMS. This variable can be modified only
by the NMS. This variable is not relevant for the trap
adnPmdFailed because the file has not been built.
adnPmdTargetIdentification indicates the chassis, slot
and processor where the PMD has failed.

description: This object provides the status of the reference
clocks on the chassis midplane. It is a bit map
and a set bit indicates clock presence.
The bit positions refer to the following clock references:
1 - primary 8 kHz MSC (Medium Speed Coupler) - (H80B)
2 - backup 8 kHz MSC - (H81B)
4 - primary SDH (Synchronous Digital Hierarchy)
8 - backup SDH
16 - primary PDH (Plesiochronous Digital Hierarchy)
32 - backup PDH
In a multi-chassis system, a value of 0 indicates that
all clock references are down. In a single-chassis system
the value of this object is 0.
variables.name: ADN-MIB::adnChassisMidplaneClockStatus

description: This object provides the status of the clock propagated from
this chassis to the next. It is a bit map and a set bit
indicates that the clock is present.
1 - primary 8 kHz MSC (Medium Speed Coupler)
2 - backup 8 kHz MSC
4 - primary line timing (LT0)
8 - backup line timing (LT1)
16 - primary SDH (Synchronous Digital Hierarchy)
32 - backup SDH
64 - primary PDH (Plesiochronous Digital Hierarchy)
128 - backup PDH
A value of 0 indicates that no clocks are being
propagated. Note that the value of this object is
0 for a single-chassis system.
variables.name: ADN-MIB::adnChassisClockPropagationStatus

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: The textual name of the interface. The value of this
object should be the name of the interface as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name, such as `le0' or a simple port number, such as `1'
depending on the interface naming syntax of the device. If
several entries in the ifTable together represent a single
interface as named by the device, then each will have the
same value of ifName. Note that for an agent which responds
to SNMP queries concerning an interface on some other
(proxied) device, then the value of ifName for such an
interface is the proxied device's local name for it.
If there is no local name, or this object is otherwise not
applicable, then this object contains a zero-length string.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifName

description: For values 1 to 8 :
this variable gives details on transitory failures
of a CU (Control Unit) card.
Other values :
this variable gives details on failures on signals
from or to a BBSYN card.
For the other cards, this variable is not significant;
see adnEquipTrapCause to know the reason of the last
failure.
The value zero indicates that there is no such type
of failure.
value failure
1 : Hardware problem on one LSN link (Local Sub-Network).
2 : At least one partition on this card is desynchronized.
3 : No contact is possible with this card.
4 : Hardware error.
5 : An error occurred during the initialization.
6 : The rebuild has failed.
7 : The rebuild of the card has to be done by
the HSS supervision.
8 : Unknown software or firmware version
601 : primary external source recovery
602 : primary external source loss of signal
603 : primary external source qualification failure
604 : primary external source Alarm Indication Signal
605 : primary external source Loss Of Frame
606 : primary external source Excessive Error Indication
607 : primary external source Message failure indication
701 : secondary external source recovery
702 : secondary external source loss of signal
703 : secondary external source qualification failure
801 : primary line timing source recovery
802 : primary line timing source loss of signal
803 : primary line timing source qualification failure
901 : secondary line timing source recovery
902 : secondary line timing source loss of signal
903 : secondary line timing source qualification failure
1001 : partner BBSYN signal recovery
1002 : partner BBSYN loss of signal
1003 : partner BBSYN signal qualification failure
1101 : PDH output enable
1102 : PDH output disable
1201 : SDH output enable
1202 : SDH output disable
1301 : MSC output enable
1302 : MSC output disable.
variables.name: ADN-MIB::adnBoardFaultStatus

description: The main PMD sub-system sends this trap to the NMS to
indicate that a crash occurred on a MSC (Medium Speed
Coupler).
This trap is only a crash quick report. To get more
information, the operator has to check the PMD file (if
it has been authorized to be created : see adnPmdMib).
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ADN-MIB::adnPmdMscCrashIndication ADN-MIB::adnNodeTime i 9999 ADN-MIB::adnTrapCategory i 1 ADN-MIB::adnPmdMscCrashClass i -1 ADN-MIB::adnPmdMscCrashOrigin s EXAMPLE ADN-MIB::adnPmdMscCrashTime i 9999 ADN-MIB::adnPmdTargetIdentification i 9999

description: The value of this object identifies the current Coordinated
Universal Time (UTC) expressed in elapsed seconds by reading
the UTC real-time clock on the control unit (CU) board.
variables.name: ADN-MIB::adnNodeTime

description: For the trap currently being sent, category of the trap
that occurs as a variable-binding of an SNMP trap PDU.
variables.name: ADN-MIB::adnTrapCategory

description: This field contains the class of the crash:
- unknown(-1): the processor has been reset by an
. external cause.
- stop(0) : the reset has been asked by an process.
- str(1) : a fatal str occurred.
- system(2) : an exception or a system panic
. occurred.
- other(3) : other.
variables.name: ADN-MIB::adnPmdMscCrashClass

description: This field depends on the adnPmdMscCrashClass.
If adnPmdMscCrashClass is 'str' then the str
name is given.
If adnPmdMscCrashClass is 'stop' the process
name is given.
If adnPmdMscCrashClass is 'system' the name of
running process when the fault occurred is given.
variables.name: ADN-MIB::adnPmdMscCrashOrigin

description: This field is used to give the time the crash
occurred at the MSC (Medium Speed Coupler) level.
variables.name: ADN-MIB::adnPmdMscCrashTime

description: This variable indicates the processor experiencing
the fault.
The variable is expressed with 5 digits.
The first one gives the chassis number
the next two digits give the slot number and
the two last digits give the processor number.
So, the value CSSPP means that the PMD has been
generated by the processor PP of the slot SS of
the chassis C.
variables.name: ADN-MIB::adnPmdTargetIdentification

flash update fails.

description: The value of this object identifies the current Coordinated

description: Index field that identifies the chassis. Chassis
are numbered 1-7. The main chassis (i.e., the one
with the active Control Unit) in a multi-chassis
node is chassis number 1. In a single-chassis node,
the chassis number is 1. This number is provided
in hardware by a HLCID card which is plugged into
the midplane.
variables.name: ADN-MIB::adnBrdFlashChassisIndex

description: Index field that identifies the slot. Slots within
a chassis are numbered 1-12. The first slot on the
left when facing the front of the chassis is number
1. This number is provided in hardware through
hard-wiring on the midplane. Note that the HBSAC
board always has a special slot identifier of 30,
but this slot number is never used.
variables.name: ADN-MIB::adnBrdFlashSlotIndex

description: This object identifies a specific error for flash update.
Values are:
msupTimeout - on-line flash update failed due to a Main
Supervisor timeout.
flashWriteError - on-line flash update failed due to a
flash write error.
offlineFlashUpdateError - off-line flash update failed.
variables.name: ADN-MIB::adnBrdFlashUpdateErrorCode

description: This object identifies a specific error for flash build.
flashVolumeWriteError - an error occured while creating or writing
the flash volume file on the Control Unit.
This may be a disk space problem.
openDescriptionFileError - the flash description file can not be
opened. This may be due to a permission
problem or to the absence of this file on
the Control Unit.
descriptionFileSyntaxError - there is some syntax error within
the description file.
flashComponentFileMissing - a file to be gathered in the flash volume
can not be found on the Control Unit.
nectarFileManagementError - a Nectar File Management error occured.
otherError - any error other than the above ones.
variables.name: ADN-MIB::adnBrdFlashBuildErrorCode

variables.name: ADN-MIB::adnTrapCategory

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: The textual name of the interface. The value of this
object should be the name of the interface as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name, such as `le0' or a simple port number, such as `1'
depending on the interface naming syntax of the device. If
several entries in the ifTable together represent a single
interface as named by the device, then each will have the
same value of ifName. Note that for an agent which responds
to SNMP queries concerning an interface on some other
(proxied) device, then the value of ifName for such an
interface is the proxied device's local name for it.
If there is no local name, or this object is otherwise not
applicable, then this object contains a zero-length string.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifName

description: The value of this object is equal to the DLCI
value for this PVC end-point.

the size of address field supported by the logical
port (frLportAddrDLCILen).

description: This object is the identifier of a DS3/E3
Interface on a managed device. If there is an
ifEntry that is directly associated with this
and only this DS3/E3 interface, it should have
the same value as ifIndex. Otherwise, number
the dsx3LineIndices with an unique identifier
following the rules of choosing a number that
is greater than ifNumber and numbering the
inside interfaces (e.g., equipment side) with
even numbers and outside interfaces (e.g
network side) with odd numbers.

variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: The desired state of the interface. The testing(3) state
indicates that no operational packets can be passed. When a
managed system initializes, all interfaces start with
ifAdminStatus in the down(2) state. As a result of either
explicit management action or per configuration information
retained by the managed system, ifAdminStatus is then
changed to either the up(1) or testing(3) states (or remains
in the down(2) state).
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifAdminStatus

description: The current operational state of the interface. The
testing(3) state indicates that no operational packets can
be passed. If ifAdminStatus is down(2) then ifOperStatus
should be down(2). If ifAdminStatus is changed to up(1)
then ifOperStatus should change to up(1) if the interface is
ready to transmit and receive network traffic; it should
change to dormant(5) if the interface is waiting for
external actions (such as a serial line waiting for an
incoming connection); it should remain in the down(2) state
if and only if there is a fault that prevents it from going
to the up(1) state; it should remain in the notPresent(6)
state if the interface has missing (typically, hardware)
components.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifOperStatus

description: The textual name of the interface. The value of this
object should be the name of the interface as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name, such as `le0' or a simple port number, such as `1'
depending on the interface naming syntax of the device. If
several entries in the ifTable together represent a single
interface as named by the device, then each will have the
same value of ifName. Note that for an agent which responds
to SNMP queries concerning an interface on some other
(proxied) device, then the value of ifName for such an
interface is the proxied device's local name for it.
If there is no local name, or this object is otherwise not
applicable, then this object contains a zero-length string.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifName

initialization.

description: This TRAP indicates that a cell starvation condition,
confirmed after a persistency check, has begun on the
Circuit Emulation Service connection.

are received on the ATM connection supporting the Circuit
Emulation Service connection which means an underflow in
the received cells buffer
The persistency check consists in waiting a certain time
(default value is 2.5 s) before sending the alarm

variables.name: ADN-MIB::adnEquipX731Usage

description: The value of this object is a bitmap that qualifies the
value of the operational and administrative states.
When the value of this object is 0, none of the
status conditions are present.
bit
value resource condition
1 inTest - undergoing a test procedure
2 failed - has an internal fault preventing its
operation
4 powerOff - requires power, but is not powered on
8 offLine - requires a routine operation to put it
online
16 offDuty - is inactive by an internal control process
32 dependency - cannot operate because it depends on an
unavailable resource
64 degraded - service provided is degraded (speed
capacity, or etc.)
128 notInstalled - not present or incomplete
256 logFull - for a log only, indicates that it is full
Common name: Availability
